blocks.name: cfrgr
blocks.content: Extend class notation with friendship graphs.

blocks.name: df-frgr
blocks.content: Define the class of all friendship graphs: a simple graph is called a _friendship graph_ if every pair of its vertices has exactly one common neighbor. This condition is called the _friendship condition_ , see definition in [MertziosUnger] p. 152. (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens and Mario Carneiro, 2-Oct-2017.) (Revised by AV, 29-Mar-2021.)
blocks.origin:
axiom df-frgr(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3, setvar s4, setvar s5) {
  |- wceq(cfrgr, cab(s0, wa(wcel(cv(s0), cusgr), wsbc(s1, cfv(cvtx, cv(s0)), wsbc(s2, cfv(cedg, cv(s0)), wral(s3, cv(s1), wral(s4, cdif(cv(s1), csn(cv(s3))), wreu(s5, cv(s1), wss(cpr(cpr(cv(s5), cv(s3)), cpr(cv(s5), cv(s4))), cv(s2))))))))))
  -| diffss(s0, s2)
  -| diffss(s2, s3)
  -| diffss(s2, s4)
  -| diffss(s1, s2)
  -| diffss(s2, s5)
  -| diffss(s0, s3)
  -| diffss(s0, s4)
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
  -| diffss(s0, s5)
  -| diffss(s3, s4)
  -| diffss(s1, s3)
  -| diffss(s3, s5)
  -| diffss(s1, s4)
  -| diffss(s4, s5)
  -| diffss(s1, s5)
}
blocks.pretty:
axiom df-frgr(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3, setvar s4, setvar s5) {
  ⊢ FriendGraph = { s0 |(s0 ∈ USGraph ∧[(Vtx ` s0)/ s1][(Edg ` s0)/ s2]∀(s3 ∈ s1, ∀(s4 ∈(s1 \ { s3 }), ∃!(s5 ∈ s1, { { s5, s3 }, { s5, s4 } } ⊆ s2))))}
  ⊣ d(s0, s2)
  ⊣ d(s2, s3)
  ⊣ d(s2, s4)
  ⊣ d(s1, s2)
  ⊣ d(s2, s5)
  ⊣ d(s0, s3)
  ⊣ d(s0, s4)
  ⊣ d(s0, s1)
  ⊣ d(s0, s5)
  ⊣ d(s3, s4)
  ⊣ d(s1, s3)
  ⊣ d(s3, s5)
  ⊣ d(s1, s4)
  ⊣ d(s4, s5)
  ⊣ d(s1, s5)
}

blocks.name: isfrgr
blocks.content: The property of being a friendship graph. (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 4-Oct-2017.) (Revised by AV, 29-Mar-2021.)

thm rspc2vd(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, wff w0, wff w1, wff w2, wff w3) {
  |- wi(w0, wi(wral(s0, c0, wral(s1, c1, w1)), w2))

  -| wi(wceq(cv(s1), c3), wb(w3, w2))

  -| diffsc(s0, c2)
  -| diffsc(s0, c4)
  -| diffsc(s1, c1)
  -| diffsc(s1, c2)
  -| diffsc(s1, c3)
  -| diffsw(s0, w0)
  -| diffsw(s0, w3)
  -| diffsw(s1, w2)
} = {
  sylsyld(w0, wral(s0, c0, wral(s1, c1, w1)), w2, wcel(c3, csb(s0, c2, c1)), wral(s1, csb(s0, c2, c1), w3))
  eleqtrrd(c3, csb(s0, c2, c1), c4, w0)
  csbied(s0, c2, c1, c4, c0, w0)
  syl(w0, wi(wral(s0, c0, wral(s1, c1, w1)), wral(s1, csb(s0, c2, c1), w3)), wcel(c2, c0))
  rspc(s0, c2, c0, wral(s1, c1, w1), wral(s1, csb(s0, c2, c1), w3))
  nfral(s0, s1, csb(s0, c2, c1), w3)
  nfcsb1v(s0, c2, c1)
  nfv(s0, w3)
  raleqbidv(s1, c1, csb(s0, c2, c1), wceq(cv(s0), c2), w1, w3)

thm rspc2vd(setvar s0, setvar s1, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, wff w0, wff w1, wff w2, wff w3) {
  ⊢ (w0 →(∀(s0 ∈ c0, ∀(s1 ∈ c1, w1))→ w2))
  ⊣ (s0 = c2 →(w1 ↔ w3))
  ⊣ (s1 = c3 →(w3 ↔ w2))
  ⊣ (w0 → c2 ∈ c0)
  ⊣ ((w0 ∧ s0 = c2)→ c1 = c4)
  ⊣ (w0 → c3 ∈ c4)
  ⊣ d(s0, s1)
  ⊣ d(s0, c0)
  ⊣ d(s0, c2)
  ⊣ d(s0, c4)
  ⊣ d(s1, c1)
  ⊣ d(s1, c2)
  ⊣ d(s1, c3)
  ⊣ d(s0, w0)
  ⊣ d(s0, w3)
  ⊣ d(s1, w2)
} = {
  sylsyld(w0, ∀(s0 ∈ c0, ∀(s1 ∈ c1, w1)), w2, c3 ∈[c2 / s0]c1, ∀(s1 ∈[c2 / s0]c1, w3))
  eleqtrrd(c3, [c2 / s0]c1, c4, w0)
  csbied(s0, c2, c1, c4, c0, w0)
  syl(w0, (∀(s0 ∈ c0, ∀(s1 ∈ c1, w1))→ ∀(s1 ∈[c2 / s0]c1, w3)), c2 ∈ c0)
  rspc(s0, c2, c0, ∀(s1 ∈ c1, w1), ∀(s1 ∈[c2 / s0]c1, w3))
  nfral(s0, s1, [c2 / s0]c1, w3)
  nfcsb1v(s0, c2, c1)
  nfv(s0, w3)
  raleqbidv(s1, c1, [c2 / s0]c1, s0 = c2, w1, w3)
  csbeq1a(s0, c2, c1)
  rspcv(s1, c3, [c2 / s0]c1, w3, w2)

  diff.cv.s(s1, s0)
  diff.csb.s(s1, s0, c2, c1)

  sseq1d(cpr(cpr(cv(s0), c1), cpr(cv(s0), cv(hs1))), c4, cpr(cpr(cv(s0), c1), cpr(cv(s0), c3)), wceq(cv(hs1), c3))
  preq2d(cpr(cv(s0), c1), cpr(cv(s0), cv(hs1)), cpr(cv(s0), c3), wceq(cv(hs1), c3))
  preq2(cv(hs1), c3, cv(s0))

  adantl(w3a(wcel(c1, c2), wcel(c3, c2), wne(c1, c3)), wceq(cv(hs0), c1), wceq(cdif(c2, csn(cv(hs0))), cdif(c2, csn(c1))))

blocks.name: frcond4
blocks.content: The friendship condition, alternatively expressed by neighborhoods: in a friendship graph, the neighborhoods of two different vertices have exactly one vertex in common. (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 19-Dec-2017.) (Revised by AV, 29-Mar-2021.) (Proof shortened by AV, 30-Dec-2021.)
